text: Throwing himself from a peak, an eagle snatched a lamb. A raven saw her and trying to imitate the eagle, he jumped on a ram, but with such poor knowledge of the art that his claws became entangled in the wool, and beating his wings to the maximum he could not let go. When the shepherd saw what was happening, he took the raven and cut off the tips of its wings and carried it to his children. His sons asked him what kind of bird it was, and he said, "It's just a crow to me, but it's like an eagle". Put your dedication on what you're really prepared for, not what doesn't suit you.
title: El águila, el cuervo y el pastor
author: nan Esopo
